sentences.en: Actually , when he came to swallow it, the stuff was distinctly disappointing.
sentences.cn: 实际上, 等到他真的一饮而尽时, 这玩意儿却很使人失望.

sentences.en: He could distinctly sense the silver coins clinking in his own pocket.
sentences.cn: 他清楚地听见银圆在衣袋里响.

sentences.en: He distinctly remembered the day his father left.
sentences.cn: 他清晰地记得父亲离开的那一天。

sentences.en: He was beginning to feel distinctly uneasy about their visit.
sentences.cn: 他对他们的造访明显地感到不安起来。

sentences.en: His opinions have always been distinctly heterodox.
sentences.cn: 他的观点时常带有明显的异端色彩.

sentences.en: However, many customers found the smell of this product distinctly off-putting.
sentences.cn: 然而，很多顾客觉得该产品有一股异味，非常难闻。

sentences.en: I distinctly heard the loudspeaker calling passengers for the Turin-Amsterdam flight.
sentences.cn: 我清楚地听到扩音器里在请都灵至阿姆斯特丹航班的旅客登机。

sentences.en: In fact, his business career had distinctly unpromising beginnings.
sentences.cn: 事实上，他的经商生涯从初期就明显前景暗淡。

sentences.en: In the gathering gloom it was difficult to see anything distinctly.
sentences.cn: 在越来越暗的情况下,什么东西都看不清.

sentences.en: She was distinctly lukewarm about my idea.
sentences.cn: 她无疑对我的观点不感兴趣.

sentences.en: The foreman passed slowly along, eyeing each worker distinctly.
sentences.cn: 工头慢慢地走过来, 打量着每个工人.
这间房子看上去确实眼熟.

sentences.en: The spectacle of the former naval officers washing their dirty linen in public was distinctly embarrassing.
sentences.cn: 前海军官员们自揭伤疤的做法显然非常令人尴尬。

sentences.en: Though they talked in a low voice, they could be heard distinctly.
sentences.cn: 他们谈话的声音虽然很低, 但他们说的什么是能听得清清楚楚的.

sentences.en: We were distinctly underwhelmed by the director's speech.
sentences.cn: 主任的讲话显然令我们感觉索然无味。

words.tran_cn: 明显的；独特的；清楚的；有区别的

phrases.tran_cn: 非常重要的；极为重要的

trans.tran_cn: 明显地，无疑地，确实地，逼真
